TH.title: General Entry Policy
TH.description: Most international visitors can apply for an e-visa or get an exemption for tourism.
TH.notes: Rules vary based on your nationality. Check official e-visa portal.

FR.title: Schengen Policy
FR.description: Travelers from visa-exempt countries can enter for up to 90 days for tourism.
FR.notes: Applies to the entire Schengen area.

US.title: Standard Visa Policy
US.description: Many nationalities require a B1/B2 visa or an ESTA authorization before travel.
US.notes: Check if your country is part of the Visa Waiver Program (ESTA).

JP.title: General Tourism Policy
JP.description: Visa-free entry is available for many nationalities for short-term tourism.
JP.notes: Always check for the latest entry requirements before flying.

TR.title: E-Visa System
TR.description: Most travelers need to obtain an e-Visa online before arrival.
TR.notes: Ensure your passport is valid for at least 6 months.

IL.title: Standard Entry
IL.description: Visa exemption is granted to many countries for tourism purposes.
IL.notes: Israel does not stamp passports; an entry card is provided.

AE.title: UAE Entry Policy
AE.description: Visa on arrival or pre-arranged e-visa is required for most visitors.
AE.notes: Requirements depend on your port of entry (Dubai/Abu Dhabi).

ES.title: Schengen Area
ES.description: Spain follows the general Schengen visa-free policy for eligible nations.

defaultRequirement.title: Verify Entry Requirements
defaultRequirement.description: Visa rules depend heavily on your citizenship. Please verify with the official embassy.
defaultRequirement.notes: Policies change frequently due to international agreements.
